  Load packages and import data
```{r}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, data.table, coloc,TwoSampleMR, ggpubr, 
               ieugwasr, rio, here)

source("code/Functions.R")

here::i_am("analyses/JAK2.Rmd")

```

# eQTL

Import data 
```{r}
JAK2_eqtl <- import_data("data/export/JAK2_eqtl_TwoSampleMR.csv", 
                         "data/export/JAK2_T1D_TwoSampleMR.csv", has_beta = FALSE)
```

## Initial Manhattan plots
```{r}
manhattan_plots(JAK2_eqtl, gene_start=6052652, gene_end=6104288, title = "JAK2")
JAK2_eqtl <- JAK2_eqtl %>% filter(pos.outcome > 5900000 & pos.outcome < 6250000) 
manhattan_plots(JAK2_eqtl, gene_start=6052652, gene_end=6104288, title = "JAK2")
```

## Coloc assuming 1 causal variant
```{r}
coloc_results_JAK2_eqtl <- analyze_coloc_eqtl(JAK2_eqtl)
# coloc_results_JAK2_eqtl$coloc_D1D2 #coloc results
# coloc_results_JAK2_eqtl$D1 #data eQTL
# coloc_results_JAK2_eqtl$D2 #data t1d

```

## Regional manhattan plot

```{r}

load("data/export/JAK2_LDmat.RData")

plot_coloc(genechr = 10,
           fig_start = 5900000,
           fig_end = 6250000,
           gene_window = 50000,
           coloc_results = coloc_results_JAK2_eqtl$coloc_D1D2,
           data = JAK2_eqtl,
           D1 = coloc_results_JAK2_eqtl$D1,
           D2 = coloc_results_JAK2_eqtl$D2,
           LDmat = JAK2)

ggsave(filename = "figures/JAK2.png", height = 8, width = 6)
```

```{r}
#create Manhattan plots with vertical lines indicating the selected area (see below 2.4)
```
